casebody.data:
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF THE CITY AFFAIRS COMMITTEE OF JERSEY CITY, A CORPORATION OF THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, FOR A WRIT OF CERTIORARI. Argued November 1, 1944 Decided November 1, 1944.

Before Justices Case, Bodine and Poetes.

Eor the applicant, Leo Rosenblum. Eor the Board of Commissioners of Jersey City, Charles A. Rooney and Charles Hershenstein. ■Pee Cukiam.

We think that there are legal questions involved which are not decided in In Re Carriole, 127 N. J. L. 316, and further that these questions should receive decision in such manner that they may, if desired, be carried on to the Court of Errors and Appeals for final adjudication.

A writ of certiorari will issue, but without stay.
